thread.title: Manchester United transfer news and rumours: Ashley Young to follow Wayne Rooney to China?
thread.title_full: Manchester United transfer news and rumours: Ashley Young to follow Wayne Rooney to China?

author: James Whaling
title: Manchester United transfer news and rumours: Ashley Young to follow Wayne Rooney to China?
text:
Young could also move to China (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Chinese Super League outfit Shandong Luneng are pushing to secure a deal for Manchester United winger Ashley Young. 
That is according to ESPN, who say the England flier could follow skipper Wayne Rooney to the Far East. 
Rooney's agent is currently in China attempting to broker a deal for his client and Young could reportedly also make the switch before the Chinese transfer window closes on February 28. 
Former Fulham boss Felix Magath is in charge at Shandong and the club have apparently enlisted the help of a representative in England. Rooney's agent jets to China Rooney could move as early as next week (Photo: Reuters) 
Wayne Rooney’s agent has flown to Beijing to try to engineer the Manchester United star a lucrative move to the Chinese Super League. 
Paul Stretford flew out to the Chinese capital this week, having been given the green light to secure a move for the United skipper. He is ready to take internal flights to extend talks with interested clubs. 
Although no deal has yet been struck, Rooney has been told he can leave United by next Tuesday’s Chinese Super League transfer deadline if Stretford can clinch a deal for his client there, writes Mirror Football's David McDonnell. 
Stretford is understood to be talking to a series of clubs but recognises he needs to meet a string of criteria for his client and United to make a deal happen. Scholes urges Rooney to reject China riches Scholes has urged Rooney not to go to China (Photo: Getty Images) 
Manchester United legend Paul Scholes has urged Wayne Rooney to reject the riches on offer in the Chinese Super League. 
The Red Devils skipper continues to be linked with a move to the Far East as early as next week - with his agent jetting off to China to try and engineer a switch. 
But Old Trafford great Scholes doesn't think the club's record scorer should be heading to Asia - instead telling him to join the MLS, or return to Everton, writes Mirror Football's James Whaling. 
Speaking on BT Sport following United's 4-0 aggregate win over St Etienne in the Europa League, Scholes said: “It does look like he is going to be going somewhere, but I just don’t see China being the right place for him." Like us on Facebook
